pullRequest.body:
A copy-paste error that propagated to almost all linters -- [pointed out by Eric](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15724#discussion_r1715138669).

Resolved by inlining the corresponding definition.

In the case of the `refine'` linter, I also recycled one doc-string and removed a `refine` namespace since every declaration already had `refine` in its name anyway.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3a0fcdfd38](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15771/commits/3a0fcdfd38df2f79d5dd6f4534be020a7e661ca2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`- getLinterDupNamespace`
`--------- getLinterHash`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Much better; thank you for performing this rename! Come to think of it, "getLinter" sounds like a rather odd prefix. What do you think about "statusHashCommandLinter" (with a get prefix is that's house style) and similar?

Michael, I actually prefer inlining, since these functions appear to be used only once and their names are not really very different/more informative than the code that they hide.

I'm less sold on the alias to allow dot-notation, though!
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.

bors merge

Thanks!

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10383936068/job/28749863973)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10385676971/job/28755341728)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10385676971/job/28755340743)

Should we just inline this?
```suggestion
    if Linter.getLinterValue linter.missingEnd (← getOptions) && !(← MonadState.get).messages.hasErrors then
```
Maybe we can even `alias` `getLinterValue` in the namespace of `Lean.Option` so that we can write 
```suggestion
    if linter.missingEnd.getLinterValue (← getOptions) && !(← MonadState.get).messages.hasErrors then
```
Do you really mean this change for just the `MissingEnd` linter, or for all of them?
I mean inline all of them
Done!  I did not introduce the alias, but I inlined them as is.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: inline `getLinterHash`*
